page.title: 02ARMY BARRACKS
page.content: The Royal Engineers moved from Southwood in 1979 to{Gibraltar {Barracks,}nearer the Ministry Of Defence training area. Every 11 weeks, 800 soldiers come to the barracks for a basic training course. For 2 weeks of this they are joined by Territorial Army recruits. It is a very modern site and facilities include squash courts, a gym and a swimming pool open to the public. Single officers live opposite the barracks in{Minley Manor,}which is also used for offices. Existing buildings have been adopted to serve the army. There is pressure from the public to move the army because of the disturbance they make. The area might also be suitable for housing. One good thing is that the army provide employment for about 200 civilians.
